title: Call for an Autism Act rejected - BBC News
summary: the culture , welsh language and communications committee .
plenary begins at 13.30 with questions to the cabinet secretary for environment and rural affairs .
questions to the cabinet secretary for communities and children .
debate by individual members on the health and wellbeing benefits of physical activity .
plaid cymru debate on mental health .
welsh conservatives : recognises that there is a need for specific legislation for autism .
short debate : women , wales and the commonwealth - the role of commonwealth women parliamentarians in the post-brexit era .

documents.title: hwyl
text: and that 's it for today .
senedd live will be back on tuesday 18 october .

documents.title: helping parliaments to become gender-sensitive institutions
text: the commonwealth women parliamentarians says its network provides a means of :
building the capacity of women elected to parliament to be more effective in their roles ;

improving the awareness and ability of all parliamentarians , male and female , and encouraging them to include a gender perspective in all aspects of their role - legislation , oversight and representation ;
helping parliaments to become gender-sensitive institutions .

documents.title: women , wales and the commonwealth
text: finally today a short debate by joyce watson .
the subject : common cause : women , wales and the commonwealth - the role of commonwealth women parliamentarians in the post-brexit era .

documents.title: autism bil : proposal not agreed
text: on the proposal that the national assembly for wales :
`` recognises that there is a need for specific legislation for autism , and calls on the welsh government to bring forward an autism ( wales ) bill during the fifth assembly term . ''
there were 24 for , no abstentions and 27 against , so the proposal was not agreed .

documents.title: 'time to bed in '
text: the minister for social services and public health , rebecca evans says `` there is a need to give the new legislation and policies the time to be delivered , the time to bed in , and demonstrate their effect before we can decide whether there is need to introduce another piece of legislation . ''

documents.title: hamilton 's challenge to the labour government
text: ukip 's neil hamilton says , `` if you 've got a better way , put it forward .
if you have n't got one , let us vote for this bill . ''

documents.title: 'nothing has changed ' since 1999
text: dr dai lloyd supports the call for legislation , saying there was a lack of services for people with autism when the assembly was established in 1999 , and `` nothing has changed '' .

documents.title: 'no consistency across wales '
text: suzy davies says there have been `` some improvements '' in provision , but there is no consistency across wales .

documents.title: 'great to see autism on the political agenda '
text: great to see # autism on the political agenda today .
join us at the senedd for a debate on autism services & support
this debate is much needed

documents.title: autism act would provide 'greater clarity '
text: mark isherwood says an autism act would provide `` greater clarity '' on the care and support people with autism could expect to receive , and would put wales `` on an equal footing '' with england and northern ireland .

documents.title: debate on autism
text: members turn to a welsh conservatives debate on autism , proposing that the national assembly for wales :
recognises that there is a need for specific legislation for autism , and calls on the welsh government to bring forward an autism ( wales ) bill during the fifth assembly term .

documents.title: support for the principles in the motion
text: health secretary vaughan gething says he supports the principles in the motion today .

documents.title: waiting times 'far too long '
text: llyr gruffydd says the waiting times for child and adolescent mental health services ( camhs ) are `` far too long '' .

documents.title: 'saddened to see this nationalist thrust '
text: referring to plaid cymru 's call `` to seek powers over employment law '' , conservative angela burns says she is `` saddened to see this nationalist thrust on the agenda '' .

documents.title: plaid cymru debate on mental health
text: now a plaid cymru debate on mental health , proposing that the national assembly for wales :

regrets that prejudice towards those who have , or have had , mental health problems continues , and the impact this can have on employment , income and well-being for those with mental health problems .
believes that education about mental health should start at a young age and schools should be equipped to promote well-being amongst all pupils .

calls on the welsh government to : a ) continue to tackle prejudice and to seek powers over employment law so that protections for people with mental health problems at work can be strengthened ; and b ) ensure that all public services examine ways in which their own practices can be improved to contribute towards better mental health .

documents.title: 'working closely with ba '
text: minister for skills and science , julie james says `` the welsh government is working closely with ba .
`` job centre plus and careers wales will be asked to work with all staff affected . ''
she added , `` we have no reason to think there is any fundamental structural problem .
there is no reason for alarm for the rest of the staff '' .

documents.title: british airways confirms it 's consulting on plans
text: british airways has confirmed that it 's consulting on plans to cut 66 jobs at its maintenance base at cardiff airport .
a spokeswoman for the airline said it 's begun talks with staff and unions about `` restructuring proposals to ensure we continue to deliver a sustainable and competitive service '' .
the spokeswoman added that ba was hoping that any jobs losses would be voluntary but declined to comment further .
the huge bamc hangar at the western end of cardiff airport provides heavy maintenance work on a wide range of ba 's boeing fleet , including the 777 and 747 jumbo jets .
it employs over 700 staff .

documents.title: urgent question
text: now an urgent question by adam price :
what is the welsh government 's response to reports that british airways is looking to cut 66 jobs at its maintenance facility based at cardiff airport ?

documents.title: 'widespread consensus across all parties '
text: labour 's jenny rathbone says , `` as there seems to be widespread consensus across all parties here , i want to introduce a little urgency and , perhaps , challenge to this debate . ''
all schools should have an active travel plan , she says .

documents.title: background : active travel ( wales ) act 2013
text: the welsh government says that the active travel ( wales ) act 2013 is landmark welsh law to make it easier for people to walk and cycle in wales .
they say , `` the act requires welsh ministers to publish annual reports on the amount of active travel journeys are made in wales .

the annual report also updates on progress of the act 's implementation since it began on 25 september 2014.the act - which is considered to be a world first - makes it a legal requirement for local authorities in wales to map and plan for suitable routes for active travel , and to build and improve their infrastructure for walking and cycling every year .
`` it creates new duties for highways authorities to consider the needs of walkers and cyclists and make better provision for them .
it also requires both the welsh government and local authorities to promote walking and cycling as a mode of transport .

`` by connecting key sites such as workplaces , hospitals , schools and shopping areas with active travel routes , the act will encourage people to rely less on their cars when making short journeys . ''

documents.title: 'strong opening to debate '
text: strong opening to the # senedd debate on # activetravel and physical activity by @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: debate on physical activity
text: for the next hour a debate by individual members on physical activity .
lee waters , rhun ap iorwerth , huw irranca-davies and john griffiths are proposing that the national assembly for wales :
recognises the multiple health and wellbeing benefits of physical activity .
notes that only 35 per cent of welsh children are getting the recommended hour of physical activity that they need every day .
recognises the potential of the active travel ( wales ) act 2013 to raise levels of physical activity amongst all age groups .
calls on the welsh government to fully engage communities in identifying the new routes that would link up local destinations and would be most likely to be well used .

documents.title: 'lack of consultation with tenants '
text: carl sargeant disagrees with adam price 's claim that there was a lack of consultation with tenants about a merger between tai cantref housing association and wales and west housing .

documents.title: hearing loss
text: janet finch-saunders calls on the government to `` push local authorities to reinstate funding that 's been cut for those suffering from hearing loss '' .

documents.title: high pitch fees
text: andrew rt davies raises concerns about high pitch fees which restrict participation in sport .
mr davies last year set up the opening try for the assembly team which beat the the commons and lords team 33-14 .

documents.title: care leavers accommodation framework
text: mr sargeant says he will launch a care leavers accommodation framework on 19 october .

documents.title: measures to help young care leavers
text: next questions to the cabinet secretary for communities and children , carl sargeant .
labour am lee waters asks for an update on measures to help young care leavers access to affordable housing .

documents.title: regulations for wood chip stocks
text: labour 's david rees calls on the government to ensure that any regulations introduced for wood chip stocks are also included in planning guidance for biomass sites .

documents.title: access to the countryside
text: lesley griffiths says she `` recognises '' concerns raised by mohammad asghar about unrestricted access to the countryside .

documents.title: greenhouse gas emission targets
text: in response to simon thomas ' question on greenhouse gas emission targets , lesley griffiths confirms that the target to reduce all welsh emissions by 40 % from 1990 levels by 2020 still stands .

documents.title: 'burden ' of regulations on nitrate vulnerable zones
text: conservative paul davies raises concerns about the costs for farmers of complying with welsh government regulations on nitrate vulnerable zones .
he says the potential costs could place a heavy burden on welsh farming .
lesley griffiths says the proposals are currently out to consultation .

documents.title: including liming of soil in agricultural support schemes ?
text: lesley griffiths says the rural development programme is the main mechanism for supporting farmers .
vikki howells calls for including liming of soil in agricultural support schemes .

documents.title: how the welsh government is supporting farmers
text: plenary begins with questions to the cabinet secretary for environment and rural affairs , lesley griffiths .
the first of the tabled questions is by vikki howells : will the minister provide an update on how the welsh government is supporting farmers in the cynon valley ?

documents.title: back at 1.30pm
text: the committee is now meeting in private .
senedd live will be back at 1.30pm for plenary .

documents.title: 'savage surgery ' fears of museum boss
text: 'savage surgery ' fears of museum boss david anderson warns @ twitterid that @ twitterid would suffer if commercial functions taken away

documents.title: 'status quo is not an option '
text: `` i agree that the status quo is not an option '' says mr anderson .
he suggests the government has made a decision to go ahead with historic wales , given the manifesto commitment .

documents.title: 'tied by the legs '
text: if the museum loses management control of commercial functions it is being `` tied by the legs '' , mr anderson tells the committee .
he warns the closer that the museum gets to government `` the more the chilling effect in getting funds from elsewhere '' .

documents.title: four options
text: many members refer to the options set out in the price waterhouse cooper ( pwc ) report , investing in the future to protect the past '' which considered the future of heritage services in wales and set out four options .

documents.title: 'so little clarity '
text: `` one of our great challenges is that there has been so little clarity , even though this idea has been in the semi-public domain since april , '' says mr anderson .

documents.title: lost 33 % of its budget
text: mr anderson says that the organisation has lost 33 % of its budget in real terms since 2010 .
the argument could be that creating historic wales is the answer to that , he adds .

documents.title: 'very problematic '
text: he says the process to get to a report that led to proposals for a merger plan was `` very problematic '' .

documents.title: background
text: last month ken skates , the cabinet secretary with responsibility for culture , set out his commitment to the creation of a new body , historic wales and announced he has asked the director of the national trust wales to chair a steering group to progress the next phase of this work .

documents.title: 'concerns about at least some of the proposals '
text: mr anderson says `` it is no secret we have concerns about at least some of the proposals apparently on the table '' .
last month it was revealed the commercial functions of national museum wales and conservation body cadw may combine under a new umbrella body called historic wales .

documents.title: review of heritage services
text: the committee moves on to discuss the welsh government review of heritage services with david anderson , director general national museum wales .

documents.title: 'deteriorated astonishingly '
text: the welsh language commissioner accuses the uk government of weakening welsh language services on its main website www.gov.uk .
meri huws says welsh language provision on the site has `` deteriorated astonishingly '' since the website went live in 2012 .
ms huws says that the issue is a `` major concern '' for her office and that she has discussed the issue with uk government ministers .

documents.title: 'locking yourselves into antagonistic relationships '
text: lee waters suggest that the compliance process seems `` adversarial '' .
he asks , `` why are you locking yourselves into antagonistic relationships which may get in the way of what you 're trying to achieve ? ''
meri huws replies replies the system `` is in its early days '' , and adds that she is `` sorry if people feel the system is adversarial '' .

ukip 's neil hamilton says `` i 've derived some entertainment from your report as well as profit , although it 's the kind of entertainment you get from a horror story nevertheless it is clear that action is being taken to stop the rot and so we should n't be wholly negative about what you 've reported . ''

documents.title: 'clinical need '
text: meri huws says the ability to communicate through the medium of welsh is not only a right , but it is a clinical need within the nhs in wales .
she says that we need to make sure that the policy `` more than words '' is central to health and social services , and social care services , and not on the sideline .

documents.title: 'quite horrified by some of the stories '
text: `` i was quite horrified by some of the stories that you printed in your report about the experiences of people at receptions and so on , '' says dawn bowden .
part 2 of the report , on quality of experiences , outlines examples of welsh language users experiencing a lack of respect and courtesy in some instances , such as `` what ?
can you speak english ?
`` , `` i 'm sorry , i have n't a clue what you said . ''

documents.title: proactively offering welsh language services
text: meri huws agrees with dr dai lloyd about the importance of proactively offering welsh language services , rather than people having to ask for services in welsh .

documents.title: 'revolutionise the culture within establishments '
text: `` we need to revolutionise the culture within establishments '' says the labour member jeremy miles .
meri huws says `` once a chief executive understands 'why ' , 'how ' is much easier . ''

documents.title: background
text: over half a million people in wales speak the welsh language , namely one in every five .

the 2011 census showed that a significant number of welsh speakers live in every corner of wales - in the urban and populated areas of the south-east such as cardiff where over 36,000 speak the language and the rhondda with over 27,000 welsh speakers , as well as the rural areas of mid and west wales such as ceredigion where there are over 34,000 welsh speakers and powys where 24,000 speak the language .

documents.title: 'difficult to compare two reports '
text: meri huws accepts the point made by the committee chair , bethan jenkins , that it is difficult to compare this report with last year 's .
ms huws says that the decision was taken to structure the report differently in order to better reflect the experiences of users of welsh language services .

documents.title: witnesses
text: ( left to right )
gwenith price , director of compliance and enforcement / deputy commissioner ;
meri huws , welsh language commissioner ;
steffan jones , senior compliance officer .

documents.title: bore da
text: welcome to senedd live .
the culture , welsh language and communications committee is meeting this morning .
it starts with a scrutiny session of the welsh language commissioner , meri huws .
